About

CDMUG stands for Chicago Drupal Meet Up Group. CDMUG is a local user group for Drupal in the Chicago area. We organize events where people meet and share information on Drupal.
  • Groups.Drupal.org/Chicago
  • Drupal.Meetup.com/1
  • CDMUG.ORG
  • Twitter.com/CDMUG

DrupalCamp Chicago is an annual conference organized by CDMUG. Our 4th annual DrupalCamp will be Saturday December 10th 2011 at One North Wacker Drive in the UBS Tower Conference Center, located in downtown Chicago next to Ogilvie Transportation Center and Union Station. $40 each for individuals and covers a full day of programming, lunch, but only 300 registrations are available.

  • Register now because our past camps have sold out.
  • Sponsorship opportunitiesare also available.

The camp will feature both scheduled sessions and “unconference” content on 9am-5pm Saturday Dec 10th. Sessions are proposed by community volunteers and programming decisions will be made based on the voted interests and Drupal experience level of the attendees. In addition to the scheduled sessions, the camp will feature space for community gatherings, Birds of a Feather (BoF) sessions, hands-on-training and more!

What to Bring

  • Computer, laptop, tablet (and power adapter)
  • Surge protector or extension cord (labeled with your name)
  • Notebook
  • Business cards
  • An unhealthy love for all things Drupal

Also Allowed

  • Digial or video camera
  • Podcasting gear
  • Your cell phone, set to vibrate please

More about CDMUG

Chicago Drupal Meet Up Group (CDMUG) is a developing resource to grow Chicago's Drupal Community. RSVP @ meetup.com for our next event or learn from our training services. CDMUG has 900+ members and draws 50 – 80 members, on average, each monthly meet up. Plus we organize our annual DrupalCamp Chicago. Group environment is very open – we discuss ideas, debug problems, and brainstorm current personal or client Drupal projects. View our video presentation archive of past events. Meet Ups take place monthly at Duo Consulting in downtown Chicago. A projector will be available, free wifi, and laptops are encouraged. All skill levels are welcomed, remember business cards.
